channel.title: Auto Cache-Downloader Problem
channel.description: Okay So I'm trying to fix the Auto-Cache Downloader for my Server and I ran into this problem as the cache was trying to DL [IMG]http://i1299.photobucket.com/albums/ag74/GfxDesignerRainz/Ek2yzsD_zpszdzetdxm.png[/img]

item.description:

not a rar.[/quote]

item.title: Auto Cache-Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“Lanepker, post:1, topic:549971”]Okay So I’m trying to fix the Auto-Cache Downloader for my Server and I ran into this problem as the cache was trying to DL
[/quote]

Change the =0 at the end of your DL link to =1 (This just tells it to automatically download)

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Cache-Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @Planet_X Planet X
item.description:
@Planet_X wrote:

[quote=“Lanepker, post:1, topic:549971”]Okay So I’m trying to fix the Auto-Cache Downloader for my Server and I ran into this problem as the cache was trying to DL
[/quote]

You’re clearly a beginner. First off, the first and second line of cmd tells you your problem.
"The filename, or directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect."
Meaning the location of your ‘cache’ you’re trying to make auto downloads directory is probably wrong, or you have a typo.
Change the directory; ‘where it’s located,’ and relook make sure you changed the NAME to your caches name aswell. Pro tip, next time show pictures of your directory locations / files. Hope this helped!

Read full topic
